intro: Siphocampylus radiatus var. brevidentatus, commonly known as the short-toothed suncup, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are pinnately divided with short, stout teeth, giving it its specific epithet "brevidentatus." The species is often found in rocky soils and open habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments.
